thread.title: Caldwell says he's done talking about controversial play
thread.title_full: Caldwell says he's done talking about controversial play

title: Caldwell says he's done talking about controversial play
text:
Caldwell says he's done talking about controversial play Posted: Updated: 
ALLEN PARK (AP) -- Jim Caldwell doesn't want to talk any more about the controversial way his Detroit Lions lost Monday night -- and he doesn't want his players talking about it either. 
Caldwell says he doesn't want the Lions to be distracted by more discussion of Calvin Johnson's fumble on Detroit's final possession in a loss to Seattle. 
The ball was knocked out of the back of the end zone by the Seahawks' K.J. Wright. Rather than flag him for illegally batting the ball, officials ruled the play a touchback. 
Caldwell said he spoke with NFL VP of Officiating Dean Blandino on Tuesday, but the Detroit coach would not go into detail about that conversation. 
Caldwell says defensive tackle Tyrunn Walker is out for the season with a dislocated ankle and broken leg. Most Popular Stories Most Popular Stories More>>
